alert.note: Alert for Northern Saratoga; Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 1:31PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Saratoga and southwestern Washington Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 130 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Greenwich, or 8 miles northeast of Saratoga Springs, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenwich, Gates, Northumberland, Schuylerville, Victory, Bacon Hill, Clarks Mills, Coveville, Grangerville, Victory Mills, Middle Falls, Thomson, Callahans Corners, Bald Mountain, Starks Knob and Fort Miller. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
